headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Magnetic Telegraph Company's Offices--No. 43 Wall-street and Astor House, Hotel entrance. Arrival of the Quaker City at NewOrleans. THE TEHUAVTEPEC ROUTE OPEN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship quaker City Capt. SHUFELUT. from Minatulan at 8 o'clock on Die morning of the 2d inst., arrived here at 2 o'clock this afternoon, and brings the welcome interigence of the opening of the Tehuanteper route. She made the outward passage in seventy hours.

headline.main: THE SLAVERY QUESTION.; Speech of Senator J. H. Hammond. of South Carolina, at Barnwell, S. C., The South Still to Rely upon the North for Justice and Security. Important Statement of Southern views and Opinions.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: The following statements may be interesting to persons desirous of knowing something of the condition of the Old World in regard to Education: In France the number of primary schools in 1843, was 59,638; the...

headline.main: Statistics of Schools and Education in the Several European States.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: The following statements may be interesting to persons desirous of knowing something of the condition of the Old World in regard to Education: In France the number of primary schools in 1843, was 59,638; the number of normal colleges for the instruction of teachers, was 96, and the number of teachers actually engaged in instruction, 75,535;

docs.snippet: The additional returns of the Election in this State received since our last issue do not materially change the character of tile result as then Indicated. It is believed, however, that HASKIN is defeated for Congress, though the result is still...
docs.lead_paragraph: The additional returns of the Election in this State received since our last issue do not materially change the character of tile result as then Indicated. It is believed, however, that HASKIN is defeated for Congress, though the result is still somewhat in doubt. We repeat our table of majorities for Governor throughout the State, with such additions and corrections as we have received from various sources, together with the latest telegraphic dispatches.

docs.snippet: The Board of Aldermen met last evening, Alderman DAVIS in the Chair. A remonstrance against letting the gates or any part of the work of the new reservoir, was received and referred. There was a resolution offered and referred, favoring the purchase...

headline.main: The Common Council.; The Board of Aldermen.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen met last evening, Alderman DAVIS in the Chair. A remonstrance against letting the gates or any part of the work of the new reservoir, was received and referred. There was a resolution offered and referred, favoring the purchase of the steel bell now on the Post-office, provided it is cheaper and better than bells of the usual metallic composition.

docs.snippet: The Jewish Chronicle tells the following: " A Mr. Levi Cohen, a bachelor in good circumstances, stated to us about four months since, that he had made a will some years ago, in which he had specified some intention he wished to be carried out, but...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jewish Chronicle tells the following: " A Mr. Levi Cohen, a bachelor in good circumstances, stated to us about four months since, that he had made a will some years ago, in which he had specified some intention he wished to be carried out, but since that time he had been very fortunate in business. and he wished to alter his will.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Magnetic Telegraph Company's Offices---Nos. 43 Wall-street and Astor House, Hotel entrance. FURTHER FROM INDIA. Cotton Dull and Lower--Breastuffs Steady--Console 98 1-4 @ 98 3-8. Condition of the Difficulty Between France and Portugal. EUROPE. ARRIVAL OF THE AMERICA AT HALIFAX. ADVICES THREE DAYS LATER. Intelligible Signals Again Received Through the Atlantic Cable.

docs.lead_paragraph: By Royal Mail steamship America, Captain MILLAR, from Liverpool at 10 o'clock on the morning of the 23d October, arrived at Halifax at midlight en Wednesday, Nov. 3. The America experienced unfavorable weather during the first five (lays of her passage.

docs.snippet: The police of Philadelphia made a descent, on Monday night, upon a gambling den, at No. 927 Chesnut-street. A drover, who had been fleeced, made complaint to the Mayor. When the police entered, they found thirty persons around the bank, but nobody...
docs.lead_paragraph: The police of Philadelphia made a descent, on Monday night, upon a gambling den, at No. 927 Chesnut-street. A drover, who had been fleeced, made complaint to the Mayor. When the police entered, they found thirty persons around the bank, but nobody was arrested except the alleged proprietors, named Rose, Robbins and Fricker.

docs.snippet: DAILY DUTIES.--My morning haunts are where they should be, at hone! not sleeping, nor correcting the surfeits of an irregular feast, but up and stirring; in Winter, often ere the sound of any bell awakes men to labor or to devotion;
docs.lead_paragraph: DAILY DUTIES.--My morning haunts are where they should be, at hone! not sleeping, nor correcting the surfeits of an irregular feast, but up and stirring; in Winter, often ere the sound of any bell awakes men to labor or to devotion;

docs.snippet: What has becomes of the Atlantic Telegraph: We do not mean the Cable, for everybody understands the position of that extensive, historical ligament. But what has become of that ideal transatlantic Telegraph which two months age filled everybody's...
docs.lead_paragraph: What has becomes of the Atlantic Telegraph: We do not mean the Cable, for everybody understands the position of that extensive, historical ligament. But what has become of that ideal transatlantic Telegraph which two months age filled everybody's mind and left the impression that for the next ten years nothing would be considered worthy of a thought, except that stupendous achievement of science and money which had brought the two hemispheres into immediate contact?
